response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age (22)", "high", "Younger age is associated with higher recidivism risk."),
    ("Gender (male)", "medium", "Being male is a moderate risk factor for recidivism."),
    ("Ethnicity (Hispanic)", "low", "Ethnicity alone does not significantly increase risk."),
    ("Criminal History (2 arrests, convicted)", "high", "Prior arrest and conviction history strongly predict recidivism."),
    ("Marital Status (never married, living alone)", "medium", "Lack of close social bonds can increase risk moderately."),
    ("Education (high school diploma, not in college)", "medium", "Limited educational attainment correlates with moderate risk."),
    ("Employment Stability (3 jobs in the past year)", "medium", "Frequent job changes can indicate instability, leading to moderate risk."),
    ("Substance Use (no use in past 4 years)", "low", "Absence of recent substance abuse reduces risk."),
    ("Mental Health (occasional feelings of depression)", "medium", "Symptoms of depression can contribute to recidivism likelihood."),
    ("Family Background (lived with biological dad in urban area)", "medium", "Urban upbringing and early family environment moderately affect risk."),
    ("Religious Belief (detached from spiritual guidance)", "low", "Lack of religious affiliation is not a strong predictor in recidivism risk.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Younger age is associated with higher recidivism risk.
Being male is a moderate risk factor for recidivism.
Ethnicity alone does not significantly increase risk.
Prior arrest and conviction history strongly predict recidivism.
Lack of close social bonds can increase risk moderately.
Education (high school diploma, not in college)
Limited educational attainment correlates with moderate risk.
Employment Stability (3 jobs in the past year)
Frequent job changes can indicate instability, leading to moderate risk.
Substance Use (no use in past 4 years)
Absence of recent substance abuse reduces risk.
Symptoms of depression can contribute to recidivism likelihood.
Family Background (lived with biological dad in urban area)
Urban upbringing and early family environment moderately affect risk.
Lack of religious affiliation is not a strong predictor in recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 2 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 3 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological dad in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
